page.title: 16SCAMMONDEN BRIDGE AND M62.
page.content: Scammonden Bridge is the largest single-span fixed-arch bridge in Great Britain.Built in 1971,it has a span of 120 metres and a deck 200 metres long which carries the A6025 Elland to Buckstones road across the Deanhead Cutting 36 metres above the M62 motorway.The bridge is built to withstand the severest Pennine weather conditions where windspeeds can reach 100mph.It was computer designed to give an economic yet graceful shape. The section of the M62 motorway which traverses the northern border of our block,was officially opened by the Queen in 1971.It crosses the rugged mountainous Pennines through some of the most impressive landscape in Britain.Daunting construction problems and weather conditions had to be over- come.At peak times,the M62 carries 14- 15000 vehicles an hour.
